content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 2 to node 6 in the given graph is:

2 -> 5 -> 6

Note that this is the shortest path from node 2 to node 6, even though the starting and ending points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path. Therefore, the shortest path from node 6 to node 2 would be:

6 -> 5 -> 2

This is because the graph is undirected, so there is no distinction between a path going from start to end and a path going from end to start.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 2 in the given graph is:

6 -> 5 -> 2

Note that this is the shortest path from node 6 to node 2, even though the starting and ending points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path. Therefore, the shortest path from node 2 to node 6 would be:

2 -> 5 -> 6

This is because the graph is undirected, so there is no distinction between a path going from start to end and a path going from end to start.
